Class VulkanBufferUtils

java.lang.Object
Kartoffel.Licht.Vulkan.VulkanBufferUtils
public class VulkanBufferUtils extends Object
VulkanBufferUtils provides nice functions to interact with Buffers

  • Constructor Details

    • VulkanBufferUtils

      public VulkanBufferUtils(Allocator allocator)
      Creates a new VulkanBufferUtils instance with the given allocator. This instance won't be able to do any indirect operations.
      Parameters:
      allocator - the Allocator to use

    • VulkanBufferUtils

      public VulkanBufferUtils(Allocator allocator, long commandPool, org.lwjgl.vulkan.VkQueue queue)
      Creates a new VulkanBufferUtils instance with the given allocator.
      Parameters:
      allocator - the Allocator to use
      commandPool - the commandpool to use
      queue - the queue to submit the transfers to.

  • Method Details

    • generateBuffer

      public Buffer generateBuffer(int capacity, boolean isStorageBuffer)
      Creates a Buffer with certain flags making it suited
      Parameters:
      capacity - the capacity in bytes
      isStorageBuffer - if this is should include the storage buffer bit
      Returns:
      the created Buffer

    • generateBuffer

      public Buffer generateBuffer(int capacity, int usage, boolean transferSrc, boolean transferDst, boolean storage, int memoryProperties, boolean deviceLocal, boolean hostVisible, boolean hostCoherent)
      Creates a Buffer with certain flags making it suited
      Parameters:
      capacity - the capacity in bytes
      usage - additional bits about usage
      transferSrc - if the VK10.VK_BUFFER_USAGE_TRANSFER_SRC_BIT is included
      transferDst - if the VK10.VK_BUFFER_USAGE_TRANSFER_DST_BIT is included
      storage - if the VK10.VK_BUFFER_USAGE_STORAGE_BUFFER_BIT is included
      memoryProperties - properties of the memory that should back this buffer up
      deviceLocal - if the VK10.VK_MEMORY_PROPERTY_DEVICE_LOCAL_BIT is included
      hostVisible - if the VK10.VK_MEMORY_PROPERTY_HOST_VISIBLE_BIT is included
      hostCoherent - if the VK10.VK_MEMORY_PROPERTY_HOST_COHERENT_BIT is included
      Returns:
      the created Buffer

    • generateIndexBuffer

      public Buffer generateIndexBuffer(int capacity, boolean isStorageBuffer)
      Creates a Buffer with certain flags making it suited
      Parameters:
      capacity - the capacity in bytes
      isStorageBuffer - if this is should include the VK10.VK_BUFFER_USAGE_STORAGE_BUFFER_BIT
      Returns:
      the created Buffer

    • generateTempBuffer

      public Buffer generateTempBuffer(int capacity)
      Creates a Buffer with certain flags making it suited
      Parameters:
      capacity - the capacity in bytes
      Returns:
      the created Buffer

    • generateUniformBuffer

      public Buffer generateUniformBuffer(int capacity, boolean isStorageBuffer)
      Creates a Buffer with certain flags making it suited
      Parameters:
      capacity - the capacity in bytes
      isStorageBuffer - if this is should include the VK10.VK_BUFFER_USAGE_STORAGE_BUFFER_BIT
      Returns:
      the created Buffer

    • putBuffer

      public void putBuffer(Buffer buffer, byte[] data, int srcOff, int dstOff, int length)
      Puts the specified data into the Buffer by first copying it to a temporal Buffer, then from the temporal buffer to the destination Buffer.
      Parameters:
      buffer - the buffer
      data - the data
      srcOff - source offset
      dstOff - destination offset
      length - amount of data to copy. (not byte size!)

    • putBuffer

      public void putBuffer(Buffer buffer, ByteBuffer data, int srcOff, int dstOff, int length)
      Puts the specified data into the Buffer by first copying it to a temporal Buffer, then from the temporal buffer to the destination Buffer.
      Parameters:
      buffer - the buffer
      data - the data
      srcOff - source offset
      dstOff - destination offset
      length - amount of data to copy. (not byte size!)

    • putBuffer

      Parameters:

      data - the data

      public void putBufferDirect(Buffer buffer, byte[] data, int srcOff, int dstOff, int length)

      Parameters:
      buffer - the buffer

      srcOff - source offset
      dstOff - destination offset

      public Buffer wrap(byte[] buffer, int usage, int suitable)

      Parameters:

      suitable - the memory-Suitable flags
      Returns:
      the created Buffer
